dialogues.text: (with her mouth full) I know you think it's gross... but this one time when I was sick in grade school, I started eating saltines, instead of my chicken noodle... then I took a sip of oj and... it was delicious. Sam holds his grin.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It's one of those undiscovered unknown combinations that no one should die without trying once.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Now you gotta try it. Sarah picks up two more saltines and holds them up before Sam's mouth. She leans very close, studying and guiding t the wafers like a jeweler focused on a diamond. Sam moves his head past the crackers and kisses Sarah's p lips. They make out for a moment on the bed. Sam pulls away, and Sarah continues to chew a bit of the cracker in her mouth - staring into Sam's eyes. She smiles and laughs. Just the sound of air through her The front door opens. Voices and shuffling interrupt the (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BLONDE
dialogues.text: Sarah, we're home. We brought somebody . Sam and Sarah look through the bedroom door to the living room. Sarah's pretty roommates, a 22 year old BLONDE and year old BRUNETTE place new bags of clothes and boxes of all over the floor and couch. Behind the girls is a 40-something man with a large beard earring and a brown leather vest. Some bad HIPSTER PIRATE

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Ok. Sarah watches as her roommates swarm the space. Noise. Sh looks around, trying to decide what to do. Sam leans towa her on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You wanna grab a drink at the bar?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No. I should probably call it a night.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Really? Come on. One drink. I really don't feel like going home right now.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Not tonight, ok?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Alright. Sarah climbs off the bed.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Come over tomorrow afternoon. We can hang out then.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking toward the door, Sam passes Sarah's roommates. Th don't pay any attention to him, moving around like bees w their boxes of designer shoes. Not even a smile or a nod. They are probably models... or aspiring to be. The pirate dude sits on the couch with his legs crossed - staring the other way. Aloof. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A flash of light. Through the patio door, Sam sees fireworks exploding in t sky beyond the rooftops.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Weird. Kinda late in the month for fireworks, isn't it? The girls say nothing. Awkward silence. Sam shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Leftovers, I guess. Sarah seems troubled as she turns away from the fireworks faces Sam. She tries to grin, but it reads false.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Okayyy. Well goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Goodnight .

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Ok. I'll see you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Good. Sam walks outside as Sarah closes the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam walks along the lamp-lit sidewalk, passing the houses decrepit apartments of his east side neighborhood. He spi his key chain in his hand. Sam steps into the street, reaching his car, a late model black Mustang. He stares in shock. The whole side of the car has been keyed. Scratch marks c it from fender to rear panel. A very large cartoon penis is scratched into the hood. De the paint. Enraged, Sam grabs the door handle, but quickly pulls his back. Chewed gum sticks to his fingertips, stretching ove palm in elongated wet strands.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Fuck. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sam wipes the gum onto the concrete and sits there, stari the scratch marks up and down his car. Overwhelmed. He breathes slowly but deeply. Sam hears a noise. Distant. He looks down the street and a few teenage boys crossing by some parked cars - creepin suspiciously. Standing up, Sam sneaks closer, using the cover of trees, garbage cans and a parked van. He gets within sight of th kids. Three boys. Probably thirteen to fifteen years old. Stupi grins on their faces. Keys in hand. One of them has a car of eggs. The boys chuckle as the smallest of the three kids drops pants and starts to pee on the passenger side door of som BMW. Near silent laughter. Open mouths shaking in vandal's del The boy finishes then plays with his fly - zipping up. Sam walks up to the boy casually from the darkness. The k turns. Sam grabs his t-shirt under the collar and pulls h toward a heavy punch - to the face. The boy grunts - exhaling his pain.

dialogues.speaker: STUPID BOY
dialogues.text: Uhhhh.

dialogues.speaker: STUPID BOY
dialogues.text: What the hell, man? The kid drops the carton onto the grass. Sam grabs an egg the carton and pushes it into the boys mouth. He chokes a screams as the egg mixes with the blood in his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You little fuck! One of the boys tries to help, but Sam punches him in the balls. He rolls over onto the grass. Moaning in agony. Small fireworks crackle in the distance. Sam punches the first kid again - blood flies out of his mouth. Jumping up, Sam kicks the other boy in the stomach. The k coughs and rolls in pain. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sam turns to head home. All we hear are the footsteps of the third boy as he race down the center of the street. Running away. Running away from Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside, the television is on... A news program highlights the life of missing billionaire Jefferson Sevence.

dialogues.speaker: STILL MISSING
dialogues.text: The program shows archival news footage of Sevence perfor Evel Knievel style stunts and Howard Hughes-esque exploit Sam sits alone on his balcony drinking several beers - a pack resting on the spare patio chair Sweat on his face. A sad look in his eyes. He's reading a page from the local zine "Under the Silver Lake" - holding it delicately with his sticky fingers. The headline reads: Beware the Dog Killer On the page is a drawing of a hooded man lifting an impal dog into the air with his bowie knife. We see xeroxed pics of 20's era Edendale, and silent film photographs, as Sam reads quietly to himself.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (reading) Silverlake and the east side of Los Angeles were originally built around the silent film studios. Back then the area was known as Edendale. In 1978 a Silverlake resident discovered a can of film in his basement. In the movie, a young man holds a note in front of the camera. It reads: "No one will ever be happy here until all the dogs are dead". He then shoots himself in the head with a pistol. The man was an aspiring actor who saw himself as the next Douglas Fairbanks. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SAM (cont'd) He was said to have been jealous of animals, specifically citing a deep contempt for Teddy the Wonder Dog. He resented the dog's success and blamed all dogs for his failed life. The man who found the film cannister claims that his house was originally used for training stunt dogs for early Mack Sennett shorts. This author believes the suicide of this obscure and failed actor might be the origin or impetus for the modern day dog killer. Is Edendale cursed? For now the answers remain hidden, deep below the surface... Under The Silver Lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam walks through a long tunnel. He hears dogs barking ah

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaching the end of the tunnel, Sam emerges onto a dark a wooded street. More barking - just out of sight in the trees. He steps o the road onto a wooded path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam walks slowly along the tree-lined dirt trail. Moonlit Dogs continue to bark in the distance. Sam follows their sound. He notices a dog biscuit on the ground below his feet. Pi it up, he examines it, twisting it in his fingers. He kno this brand. Sam sees another - just ahead. He follows the dark trail of multi-colored dog treats, de into the woods. Flies buzz over a small dark mass alongside the path. Sam stops and looks down. Partially covered by leaves, he sees the rib cage and hal buried head of a dog in the dirt. A Bichon Frise. Strange sounds... up ahead. Sam hears the odd noises and walks closer to them - furth down the trail. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The sound of chewing? Entering a clearing, Sam sees the back of a woman - Sarah dress, white bonnet and slippers. Is that Sarah? She's hunched down over a man's body. Eating something. As Sam steps closer, he sees the dead man's face in the moonlight. It's the missing billionaire, Jefferson Sevenc The chewing intensifies. Lips smacking. Sam hears a dog bark behind him. He doesn't look. It bark again. The woman turns around and faces him... it's not Sarah. It's an UNKNOWN MAN with blood on his mouth and face. Fle his teeth. He stares at Sam, beneath the white bonnet. Curious and innocent like a dog. Jefferson Sevence's body is in two pieces. Clearly severe the waist. The strange man barks. It sounds like the little dog, Coc Cola, yapping. Sam stares as some unseen force pulls the body's two halv opposite directions. Each dragged across the grass into t woods - as though pulled away by fishing line. Gone in a flash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam opens his eyes into the bright sun. He's curled up and drooling on the couch. The TV is still Beer cans nearby. Sam rolls over and grabs a Spider Man comic from the floo sticks to his fingertips. He shakes his hand, but the com stuck. Sam peels it off, then looks at the chewed gum, still cov parts of his hand. He exhales and shakes his head.  20 21 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam walks along the garden path towards Sarah's apartment He knocks on her front door. No one answers. Sam walks around back and steps onto Sarah's patio. Coca isn't there. The patio chairs are missing. The old newspa and dog poop are gone. The young man peeks in through the patio door. The blinds open. There's no furniture inside. The apartment is completely empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the glass-walled, log-cabin office, Sam leans agai one of the desks. A greasy haired MANAGER with a puckered face, looks up fr behind his monitor. His contempt is obvious. He stares at as though he's looking into an unflushed toilet.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: They moved out. How does that not makes sense?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Who moves out in the middle of the night?

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: They wanted to leave. They forfeited their deposit, paid the lease. They.. moved... out. Nothing strange about it.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I don't know why she wouldn't have told me?

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: I don't know. Maybe she didn't like you. Maybe she knows you're poor and you haven't paid your rent. Maybe she doesn't want to date a homeless man? Sam says nothing. He stares at the smug manager - anger brewing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Speaking of rent... this isn't personal, but I want you to know that you'll be forcibly removed if you can't pay in the next seven days.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I got it.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Ok. Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam drinks whiskey in the dark bar. Sunlight occasionally across the shadows, as patrons enter or exit. A heavy man, with a half-bald head, shifts on his stool. 43-year-old BAR BUDDY gulps his beer and rubs his ear in contemplation.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I couldn't even find her online.

dialogues.speaker: BAR BUDDY
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's kinda weird. I don't know. What do ya do?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Not sure. Two drunk women, behind tall beers, carry on their own conversation at the bar. We hear pieces of it...

dialogues.speaker: BAR BUDDY OLD DRUNK WOMAN
dialogues.text: Have you heard about these The only thing I hate more dog killers? than getting patted on the head is looooove on a schedule.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: There's more than one? YOUNG DRUNK WOMAN They always say to me "you're BAR BUDDY too pretty to be this nice" Who knows. Creeps me out. or "you don't look like you've It's one thing to get mugged, had a child." God I just wa but to have some dude stab to find somebody with a little your dog right before your financial security. I can eyes... that would traumatize dream, right? a person... fuckin' horrible.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Totally. Sam takes a sip from his glass. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FOR THOSE WHO ENJOY THE TASTE OF GOOD WHISKEY
dialogues.text: No cover-up here. Seven-Up lets your drink assert its tru acter. You always get a robust man’s drink—as an army of seasoned highball men will attest. Seven-Up mellows whisk flatters it, rounds out flavor. Caution: don’t stir. Just gently; 7-Up stirs itself. Make your next one a 7-Up bigh Copetaht Vat by The Reve Up Compane

dialogues.speaker: BAR BUDDY
dialogues.text: Maybe she left a clue?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BAR BUDDY
dialogues.text: The girl. If something bad happened, there might be... evidence. Blood on the carpet. I don't know. Sam shrugs... Sure, evidence. Why not? He takes a big swi whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam steps behind some shrubs, locating Sarah's bedroom wi He's sweaty. A bit drunk. He looks back and scans the neighboring balconies. Seems clear. No one's around. The young man slides a screwdriver behind the window scre and pops it out. Quickly, he climbs inside with a thud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam twists the blinds closed - covering the open window. He turns and faces the empty room. Dust sits along the ca edges where furniture once stood. Sam looks down the hallway into the vacant living room. H casually spins back and sees the closed closet door. He walks over and opens it. The clothes and shoes are gon But at the top of the shelf is a box. Sam pulls it down a looks inside. He sees some music CDs, a dance trophy, three collectible Barbie dolls from the "How to Marry a Millionaire" series open pack of Fruit Stripes gum, a pink vibrator and a photograph of Sarah. Sam grabs the picture of Sarah smili her white hat, and puts it in his pocket. He hears a sound. Keys rattling. The front door begins to unlock. Sam puts the box back on the shelf, steps out and closes closet door. He hears the front door click as it starts t open. Thinking fast, Sam climbs back out the bedroom window. He reaches in and settles the shaking blinds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam remains there, behind the bushes, peeking into the bedroom. Waiting to see who's arrived. A young woman, TROY, in jean shorts and a Joan Jett and t Blackhearts t-shirt, steps into the bedroom. Her hair is and "dirty white". Her face is pretty, but a little mascu A tomboy, sex-pot and scenester combined. Sam watches the girl open the closet and go inside - a cl Trader Joe shopping bag in her hand. After a moment, she emerges with the box in her arms. Setting it down in the middle of the empty room, Troy dum the contents of the box into the bag. She reaches in, gra stick of gum and puts it in her mouth. Troy picks up the bag and walks into the hallway. As she leaves, the girl closes the bedroom door - reveali marking on the wall - previously hidden. °c Through the blinds, Sam stares at the strange symbol. Drawn in pink nail polish... Two diamond shapes, joined at the tip... °c Sam stares at the symbol for a moment. Clearly puzzled. A storm door closes. Footsteps. Sam ducks and watches Troy cross by, swinging her bag of goodies along the garden path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trailing the girl from the opposite side of the street, S walks slowly, stepping behind trees and parked cars. Troy strolls along the sidewalk. A car pulls up in the intersection before her. It's a 198 Volkswagon Rabbit Wolfsburg convertible. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Two other hipster girls are inside. A black haired girl i driving. A freckled redhead in back. Familiar indie-rock pours from the speakers. Troy races up and hops into the passenger seat. The car t off towards Los Feliz Boulevard. Sam sprints to his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam drives along Los Feliz keeping the Rabbit convertible his sights - just a few cars ahead. He follows the girls, turning left onto Griffith Park Boulevard. Sam watches their car slow down and stop in front of John Marshall High School. He pulls over and waits. Troy and her friends sit still - engine running - across the football field. Some local teens pass by Sam's car. They point and laugh the penis drawing covering his hood. He ignores them. From his center console, Sam pulls out a pen and an LA Co parking ticket. He draws the secret shape on the ticket. °c Looking up, Sam notices the girls staring over at the hig school scoreboard. Some numbers flash on the visitor's si The number 7... then the number 5... and finally the numb Sam writes them on his ticket. 751 The white rabbit convertible pulls back onto the road and heads towards Rowena. Sam stays in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traveling down Sunset Boulevard... Sam follows, trailing the car toward Echo Park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun begins to set over the lake as Sam idles along Ec Park Avenue. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He watches the girls walk up to the nearby boat house. Leaving his car, Sam follows the threesome. He looks around the boat house and sees a PARK EMPLOYEE helping the girls into two red paddle boats. Troy climbs with the brunette - the Trader Joe bag over her shoulder They start to pedal away from the dock. The handsome Park Employee eyes them as they float off. Sam hops in his own blue paddle boat and starts to pedal churning water and gaining momentum. Paddling out, he fol the two red boats from a distance as they round the bend. Swishing water. Shwwww. Shwwww. Shwwww. Moving under the bridge, Sam turns the corner into the op water. The lake is calm. The orange sky reflects over the park, mixing with palm trees, flowers and the gentle gaze the Lady of the Lake statue. The girls stop pedaling. Their boats slow down and begin simply drift. The redhead waves at her friends in the fir boat. They makes faces back at her. A few splashes of wat Sam stays still, letting his boat float sideways within t lake. He casually turns and watches the girls. Waiting. Troy and her friend start to paddle together once more. F than before. Their boat reaches the opposite shore line. Sam watches as a man appears over the hilltop. He runs do over the grass and meets Troy as her paddle boat bumps ag the concrete rim of the lake. Sam recognizes the man. It's the middle-aged hipster pira saw at Sarah's. Troy passes the cloth bag to the pirate. He takes it and back up the hill. He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (whispering) Fuck. Sam looks around, and starts to turn his paddle boat towa the dock.  30 31 32 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few lengths behind the convertible Rabbit, Sam drives h car down 2nd Street towards the city. Homeless people look up from their shopping carts and cardboard beds as the black Mustang passes by. Sam enters the tunnel under Bunker Hill. He stares ahead girls sit calmly together Turning onto 6th Street, the Rabbit drives up in front of Standard Hotel. Sam trails behind, watching as Troy and h friends hop out - pulling beach towels and pool rafts fro car. The brunette passes the keys off to the SHADY VALET. The redhead pulls her t-shirt off, revealing a bikini top swings the shirt over her shoulder and smiles to the brun Sam drives closer, watching the three pretty hipsters go the back door of the hotel. Troy laughs as she blows air an inner tube - disappearing through the doorway. Pulling into a blue-lined parking space, Sam takes out a handicap-parking permit and hangs it from his mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam rides up alone. The elevator doors open. Live music p in from the rooftop patio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing before Sam is a leggy woman in a bikini and blac hat. Her extended leg in the doorway forces Sam to face h although he would have done so regardless.

dialogues.speaker: BIKINI TOP HAT GIRL
dialogues.text: Welcome to purgatory.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Uh... good to be here. I needed some time to think about things. The bikini girl smiles. She pulls a small sewing needle f plush, cherry-shaped, pin cushion and presents it to Sam.

dialogues.speaker: BIKINI TOP HAT GIRL
dialogues.text: Use it wisely. Sam smirks and slides the pin through the pocket of his s as he walks on. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He passes an identical girl, performing an identical gree to a small crowd exiting the adjacent elevator. A POET dressed like a 1940's housewife marches by, steppi across the furniture and tables while reading poetry agai the loud music. She tears little pieces of paper from her page and drops them to the ground like rose petals.

dialogues.speaker: HOUSEWIFE POET
dialogues.text: All these... holy trinities of women... thriving like plants... under the heat... of the city's male gaze....three three three... three three three... three three three... Sam scans the area for Troy and the girls. He sees them sitting down on a big couch near the stage. A live band i playing before a crowd. Stepping closer, Sam sees the understated singer and his gorgeous female band. It's Jesus and the Brides of Dracul made clear by the accompanying signage and drum logo. The THREE BRIDES are all in white 1920's gowns with pale and sad eyes. JESUS is in old blue jeans - bare chested w cross around his neck. Sam moves closer as the band kicks into a prolonged music Faster and faster, the tempo rises. The crowd parts as a dancer emerges from behind the stage draws all attention - including Sam's. A teenage girl in a green unitard dances provocatively we an enormous mass of multi-colored balloons. BALLOON GIRL smiles and gyrates. Her arms wave in the air as her shoul sway. Suddenly she begins to scream over the pounding drums. Al part of the act, but strange nevertheless. Balloon girl dances through the crowd screaming as everyo pokes and pops the balloons with their sewing needles. Pop. Pop. Pop. Pop. Pop. The music reaches a crescendo and ends with a final roar Sam watches as balloon girl emerges from the mob - she's covered in deflated rubber over her nylon suit. She stare at the sky, as though healed by Pentecostal powers. The crowd cheers as the band disappears behind a curtain. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: I love you Jesus! Sam pulls the sewing needle from his shirt and tosses it the edge of the roof - without thinking twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loud music everywhere. Sam sits down along the edge of the pool - jeans rolled u feet in the water. He sips his fruity cocktail and watche Troy and her girlfriends strip into their bathing suits. Troy kicks off her sandals and dives into the water. Sam watches Troy swim to the far edge of the pool. The yo woman climbs onto a raft and lays back - she pulls a flas from her waist-band and takes a swig. The redhead, FANNIE, a freckled and slightly plump beauty stretches and yawns at the edge of the pool. Her teeth ar oddly spaced - a missed opportunity for braces - but even mistake contributes to her appeal. The black haired girl, MAE, steps cautiously into the poo She's slim with dark features - girlish compared with her friends - a bob haircut more at home in the 1970's than t millennial teens.

dialogues.speaker: MAE
dialogues.text: Is Jesus still here or did he leave already? Sam fixes his sights on Troy. She is calmly spinning slow circles on her raft.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: I'm not sure.

dialogues.speaker: FANNIE
dialogues.text: He's with one of the brides I think. Fannie climbs down the ladder into the blue tank. She sta to swim.

dialogues.speaker: MAE
dialogues.text: Romantically?

dialogues.speaker: FANNIE
dialogues.text: Probably. Sam drinks and eavesdrops - trying to look like he belong (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAE
dialogues.text: Seems like he's making his way through all of ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: One bride at a time.

dialogues.speaker: FANNIE
dialogues.text: He's a romantic. Fannie and Mae laugh together as Troy grins. She takes an gulp from her flask.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: You don't become a bride without fucking Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: MAE
dialogues.text: If he wasn't so good looking he'd never get away with it. Troy climbs out of the water, looking back at her friends

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Blessed by his holy father I guess. Sam watches as Troy heads to the bathroom. He stands up a follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The toilet flushes and Troy opens her stall. Sam is stand between her and the sink. Troy gives him a dirty look and tries to walk around him. Sam blocks her path, holding up photo of Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Do you know this girl? The girl looks at the photograph, but says nothing. She s at Sam - looking him up and down.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Do you know where she is? Troy spits her gum in Sam's face. It hits his nose and fa to the floor. Sam grabs her arm and yanks her closer

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Fuck you. Seriously. Is she ok? Troy knees Sam in the balls. She pulls away from his grip he falls to the floor. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She runs out. A fresh group of drunk hipster girls walk into the bathro and see Sam on the floor. They make ugly faces at him and - strong and very aggressive - flashing gang signs from p they've never visited.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM GIRL
dialogues.text: Get the fuck outta here. It's the ladies room.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER BATHROOM GIRL
dialogues.text: Piece of shit. Asshole. As the girls shout and curse, their barking becomes liter From their sweet mouths come deep and disturbing dog bark

dialogues.speaker: AND ANOTHER BATHROOM GIRL
dialogues.text: Fuckin' toilet licker The girls cackle and laugh at their explosion of expletiv Sam tries to sit up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam hobbles, hunched over, through the beautiful crowd. I even louder than before. One of the Brides of Dracula, a green-eyed beauty in over reading glasses and grey lipstick, chats energetically wi gentle giant. Sam passes by the READING GLASSES BRIDE, moving toward th pool.

dialogues.speaker: READING GLASSES BRIDE
dialogues.text: We thought about naming ourselves Jesus and the Brides of Frankenstein. Cause there's just so much vampirism in pop culture, we were worried the Dracula thing might be a little tiresome.

dialogues.speaker: GIANT HIPSTER WITH GIANT BEARD
dialogues.text: I think it works for you. This conversation, and others like it, plays out in the background - overlapping with the primary story. Altman-e

dialogues.speaker: READING GLASSES BRIDE
dialogues.text: Yeah. There's something liberating about 1920's fashion. Obviously there's the whole "undead flapper girl" thing. Ya know...

dialogues.speaker: MORE
dialogues.text: ( ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: READING GLASSES BRIDE (cont'd) all women are condemned as monsters the moment they start doing the Charleston. Fuck society, right?

dialogues.speaker: GIANT HIPSTER WITH GIANT BEARD
dialogues.text: I agree... Moving past the crowd, Sam finally gets a clear view of t pool area. Troy and the girls are gone. A HAND lands hard on Sam's shoulder. He jumps.

dialogues.speaker: FAUX ANGRY VOICE
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?! Sam spins around and sees ALLEN, a grinning guy with flop hair and a chiseled jaw - laughing and patting Sam's back

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Hey, Allen. Good to see you. Allen gives Sam a hug. Sam looks down at Allen's attire. Though very masculine, Allen wears a few pieces of women' clothing - slightly repurposed for irony or comfort's sak

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Is that a woman's blouse?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I guess so.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Keepin' busy with work?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Of course. How 'bout you? Allen drifts through the conversation. Floating in both w and gestures.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Yeah you know... workin'. Mostly, thinkin' about things. How does the world work? Why are we swimming on rooftops when there's an ocean right over there. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sam stands more still than the others - less at ease in t world of artists and secret socialites. Also, he was just kneed in the balls.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Well I don't have any answers.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Nobody does. Allen grins, nodding and patting Sam on the shoulder a fe more times.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Hey, do you know a blond, a redhead and a brunette that drive a Rabbit convertible?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: No, but I'm looking forward to meeting ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Well... I'm... trying... A beautiful black girl in a sparkling emerald evening gow walks up to Allen. He smiles to the EMERALD BEAUTY and po to her dress.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Hey! I like the dress. The girl smiles and tips her chin in flirtatious recognit

dialogues.speaker: EMERALD BEAUTY
dialogues.text: Thanks, Allen. Emerald Beauty stares over Allen's shoulder

dialogues.speaker: EMERALD BEAUTY
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Take a look. Both Allen and Sam turn and see a leggy brunette in gold shorts. It's Millicent Sevence. She's drinking, laughing and flirting with another girl.

dialogues.speaker: EMERALD BEAUTY
dialogues.text: Isn't that Millicent Sevence?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I think so. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: EMERALD BEAUTY
dialogues.text: What is she doing here? Isn't her dad kidnapped or something?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Not a very classy move.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (feeling his groin) It's hard to say what a person might do when they're in pain. The pair ignore Sam, as they scoff and stare. Emerging from the crowd in her white gothic gown, one of Brides of Dracula edges into the circle. A fragile doll. The MEEK BRIDE waves at the group like a shy schoolgirl - wicker basket filled with cookies in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: MEEK BRIDE
dialogues.text: I'm doing a secret solo show tomorrow night at Hollywood Forever if you wanna come.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'd love to.

dialogues.speaker: MEEK BRIDE
dialogues.text: These are your tickets. The girl delicately hands both Allen and Emerald Beauty a homemade cookie. The Meek Bride looks at Sam, pauses and him one too - like Valentine's day in grade school. Every gets a card if you show up.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDE
dialogues.text: Don't eat it or break it. If it's missing anything, even a crumb, they won't let you in. Sam looks at the cookie in his hand - frosted with green piping - the number 76.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Thanks. The Meek Bride offers a half-grin then turns to deliver m VIP treats to the crowd. She repeats her pitch. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MEEK BRIDE
dialogues.text: (moving into the crowd) I'm doing a secret solo show tomorrow night at Hollywood Forever if you wanna come... Emerald Beauty looks down at her iphone, reading her twit feed.

dialogues.speaker: EMERALD BEAUTY
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: EMERALD BEAUTY
dialogues.text: It looks like they found Millicent's dad.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: EMERALD BEAUTY
dialogues.text: His body was burned or something.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: He's dead?

dialogues.speaker: EMERALD BEAUTY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Does she know? All eyes turn towards Millicent Sevence. The billionaire' daughter pulls away from a sapphic kiss, and makes a funn face as she reaches for her drink. Emerald Beauty whispers something to a MALE MODEL. A few people around Millicent start to look up from their smart phones, reacting to some terrible news. More and more peo within the crowd turn their attention toward the young wo Millicent sways and laughs. A chain reaction of hushed whispers. Elbowing between fri Faces looking up from iphones. Chatter and gossip. Sam watches this from the edge. Everyone waits for Millic to hear what they already know. A girl runs through the crowd and whispers into Millicent ear. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sam watches the young woman's face. She's devastated, but holds it in. Millicent walks slowly through the hipsters to the elevat She's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam opens the outer security gate. Fog drifts across the garden walkways of Sam's complex. A foreboding quality in the night air Sam walks alone. It's quiet except for crickets and the sound of water rip in the stream. Sam hears footsteps behind him. He turns and looks back. No one is there. Darkness. We move with Sam, tracking through the foggy walkway. The young man steps nervously - alert. Sam's cell phone rings. He answers.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: COMIC MAN
dialogues.text: (on phone) Hi, um... one of the guys at Secret Headquarters, the comic store, gave me your number. They said you wanted to talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Oh shit, yeah. I read your zine. I wanted to ask you more about it. Is there a time we could meet up?

dialogues.speaker: COMIC MAN
dialogues.text: (on phone) Sure. I'll be drawing all day tomorrow. You're welcome to stop by the house. Sam hears something again. He spins back as a dark figure crosses the path - into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Cool. Could you text me your address? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sam stares back. Concerned.

dialogues.speaker: COMIC MAN
dialogues.text: (on phone) Yeah I can do that. Still watching - no movement.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Great. I'll see ya then.

dialogues.speaker: COMIC MAN
dialogues.text: (on phone) Yeah. See you tomorrow. Sam hangs up his phone and stares into the darkness. Listening. He sees a shadow lean out from behind a distant building. again. Sam turns and starts to jog ahead. He looks around anxiou Through the dark garden path. In and out of the lamp ligh Reaching an intersection of paths, Sam slows down and loo his right. He notices a man standing in the center of the walkway. The man is not moving. His body and face are shrouded in darkness. Sam turns left and starts to run. He doesn't look back Turning another corner, Sam scrambles and climbs behind a large tree. Loud rustling - behind him. A strange cry. Sam turns and sees black fur rising from the brush within tall grass. It's the rear end of a skunk The animal shakes and sprays. Sam covers his head and clo his eyes as the skunk bathes him in its odor. Sam staggers out of his hiding place, wiping the fluid fr his face. His eyes water. He hunches over on the sidewalk begins to heave. Sam vomits on the walkway. Cough. Choke. Sitting there, he tries to open his eyes. Slow and painfu The fluid stings. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sam opens his eyelids - just enough. He looks up the gard path and sees no one. The shadow man is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing on his kitchen tile, Sam strips off his clothes a garbage bag. The television is on nearby. A beautifully decorated cookie sits on his counter-top ne Sarah's photo and a parking ticket covered in symbols and scribbles.

dialogues.speaker: MALE REPORTER
dialogues.text: (on tv) Yes. I agree. The city is in shock at the loss of such a cultural landmark. This man has literally been the face of Los Angeles for decades through his charity work, his Hollywood production company, the New Year's Eve telecast, his public appearances at Awards shows, the Rose Parade... the list just goes on and on... Leaning over in his underwear, Sam watches the news repor see helicopter footage of a burned up Deusenberg near Sil Lake Boulevard and the 101. Sam pulls his briefs down and tosses them into the bag.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE REPORTER
dialogues.text: (on tv) It's hard to believe, but the Los Angeles Police Commissioner has confirmed that the remains are those of Jefferson Sevence. As we reported earlier, Sevence was found dead in his car with the bodies of three women believed to be prostitutes. This catches Sam's attention. He runs across the room and stands before the television, naked. He watches intensely.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE REPORTER
dialogues.text: (on tv) In addition, some unnamed sources have leaked a very odd detail about the case. Apparently the remains of a dog, a breed known as Bichon Frise, were found in the purse of one of the victims. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FEMALE REPORTER (cont'd) This has officially become a very grisly and puzzling murder investigation. Sam watches the crime scene footage. A detective carries evidence bag into a police van. Reporters and cops everyw Sam tilts his head, and presses a button on his cable box screen pauses. He zooms in with the remote - focusing on the grainy imag the crime scene bag. It's white and charred. Concerned with neither his odor nor his nudity, Sam grabs Sarah's photo from the counter He holds the picture up, examining the details of Sarah's white bonnet - the pink ribbon hanging near her ear. He compares it against the tv screen, zooming-in once mor Though it's a fuzzy blur, the burnt white cloth and pink ribbon are clearly visible within the evidence bag. It's Sarah's hat.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open tin cans sit on the bathroom sink. Inside the tub is soaking in tomato juice - scrubbing the skunk scent from body. The actress is on the floor, wearing a slutty nurse outfi and plugging her nose. She reads out loud to Sam - a page from "Under the Silver Lake".

dialogues.speaker: ACTRESS
dialogues.text: (reading) Who is the Owl's Kiss? The actress turns the zine around and shows Sam the pictu accompanying the typewriter essay. It's a cartoon depicti a naked woman in an owl skin mask with a large tuft of pu hair between her legs.

dialogues.speaker: ACTRESS
dialogues.text: According to this picture it's a naked lady with an unshaven bush. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sam shakes his head and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Just read it. The actress makes a face and returns to her duty.

dialogues.speaker: ACTRESS
dialogues.text: (reading) The Owl's Kiss is a lost legend of folklore. Just as terrifying as the Wolfman or Frankenstein's Monster. She is a woman who arrives in the night, through windows and locked doors, naked except for her mask of taxidermied owl skin. She seduces men and women alike, killing them in their sleep. This beautiful spectre is responsible for dozens of deaths within the Los Angeles basin, though she has yet to be mentioned by mainstream media. Theories abound as to her motives. This author believes she may be a member of a longstanding American cult with origins in trade and finance. It's the unlucky soul who finds himself the recipient of an owl's kiss. The actress raises her brow and tosses the zine on top of toilet.

dialogues.speaker: ACTRESS
dialogues.text: What a bunch'a horse shit. Sam nods out of respect as the young woman rests her back against the sink. White nylon legs sprawled unshyly over floor.

dialogues.speaker: ACTRESS
dialogues.text: I can't believe Jefferson Sevence is dead. Sam listens, scrubbing his face with soap and tomato juic dunks his head into the bath once or twice. Rinsing his h

dialogues.speaker: ACTRESS
dialogues.text: Every year more and more celebrities and people I grew up with keep dying. Dick Clark... Elizabeth Taylor... Johnny Carson. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Everybody dies... even the people we think will be here forever. with her nose still plugged, the actress's voice sounds e strange and nasally.

dialogues.speaker: ACTRESS
dialogues.text: I remember hearing my aunt talking about that feeling - realizing how quick it all goes. It's one of those things you don't understand until you're in it.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Have you lost anybody? Anybody close? The actress just nods. She looks at Sam.

dialogues.speaker: ACTRESS
dialogues.text: You? Sam shakes his head. Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I think about it though. A lot more than I should. The actress pets the top of Sam's head. He looks like a b child in the tub... an old baby covered in his food.

dialogues.speaker: ACTRESS
dialogues.text: Hey, what were those pages on your nightstand? The ones with all the scribbles?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Ehhhhh. That's nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ACTRESS
dialogues.text: No. Tell me. I wanna know.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You'll get all weirded out.

dialogues.speaker: ACTRESS
dialogues.text: No I won't. You've seen me doing my chants and my prep work. I don't care if it's weird.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Ok. Have you ever heard about old record albums having satanic messages in them if ya play 'em backwards? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ACTRESS
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Ok... so I was watching wheel of Fortune and I noticed that Vanna White did this little pattern of glances every so often. She looked forward then right then left and then back again. And I started wondering... is that random or is there a reason for it? Is there a pattern behind it? And if there is, maybe there's something meaningful in that pattern. The actress stares and listens as Sam continues explainin strange theory.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: So I started taking note of when it happened... and for the past 7 months I have a complete record of it. It doesn't happen everyday... it's literally every three episodes except for one time. Also, it seems to happen most Wednesdays except for last Wednesday which happened to be a holiday. So I graphed it out and I got some old code books from the library and I've been digging through them, trying to see if it translates to anything... like a word or a message... something. The actress smiles nervously, making a slight sound from throat as she adjusts her legs. Sam speaks faster and fas

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I mean, I've just been thinking, why do we assume that all of this infrastructure and entertainment and open information beaming all over the place into every home on the planet is exactly what people tell us it is? Maybe there are people more important more powerful or wealthier than us that communicate things or see things in the world that are meant for them and not for us. I think it's fucking ridiculous to assume that media only has one purpose... right? The actress stares at Sam - frozen. She's freaked out, bu tries to hide it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You think that's weird?

dialogues.speaker: ACTRESS
dialogues.text: A little.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: It's not weird. Don't you ever feel like rich people know something that you and I don't?

dialogues.speaker: ACTRESS
dialogues.text: Like good restaurants, maybe. Frustrated, Sam splashes tomato juice over his chest. He exhales deeply.

dialogues.speaker: ACTRESS
dialogues.text: Don't take this the wrong way, but you smell so bad. I think I'm gonna get going. The actress starts to stand up. Stretching.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Ok. Um... thanks for the juice.

dialogues.speaker: ACTRESS
dialogues.text: I'll be back when the smell goes away. The young woman walks out of the bathroom, leaving Sam al

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sits on his couch watching Wheel of Fortune - a noteb and pen in his hand. He hears squeals of laughter and water splashing outside window. Sam walks out to his balcony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking down at the pool, Sam sees Sarah swimming alone i blue water. Sarah splashes... laughing like Marilyn Monroe. She swims closer, looking up at Sam. He realizes that she naked. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Come on in. The water is so refreshing. Sam watches as Sarah reaches the nearest edge of the pool props herself on her elbows and lifts a single leg up ont deck - mimicking Marilyn. She giggles and laughs with a g grin. Sam stares. More laughter Sarah climbs out and sits on the edge of the pool. With h back to us, she turns and smiles over her shoulder... tea her body. She begins to bark at us - the sound of a large dog - something vicious. Her face is beautiful but her barks are horrific. Sam watches as she playfully hops back into the pool and underwater. Splash. It's quiet now. Sam leans over the railing and looks down The water settles... no one is in the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam opens his eyes, rolls out of bed and looks straight o the window. He sees police stringing crime-scene tape ove Sarah's apartment door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam exits his apartment gate and walks up the street. He notices a leggy woman in a short red dress climbing out o Prius. RED MINISKIRT walks daintily ahead of him on the sidewalk passing a drunk homeless man in the grass. Sam watches her ass and legs as she prances along. On the opposite sidewalk, there are more beautiful women, staggered down the block, but marching forward. A Fellini-esque parade of mini-skirt models moving down t street in Sam's direction. Sam tilts his head - trying to understand it all. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Red Miniskirt cuts across the road - pulling out her headshots. She slows down in front of an old duplex. Inside the dirty garage are several gorgeous models stand around, smiling and chatting with a heavy-set man. He sit behind a folding card table like a king. A makeshift sign reads: Movie Auditions! Sam passes the garage audition, staring at the odd circus Now behind him, Red Miniskirt paces, staring up at the tr wondering if she should leave. Sam turns a corner. Several models stand in the center of the street looking at the pavement. A look of disgust on their faces. Red spray paint covers the ground. Some sort of graffiti. Sam approaches them and the strange markings. YELLOW MINISKIRT makes a few involuntary, hushed sounds - publically advertising her horror at the message below he

dialogues.speaker: YELLOW MINISKIRT
dialogues.text: Uhhhhhhhe. Each grunt is accompanied by a body shiver and a little, involuntary two-step dance on her yellow heels. Sam keeps walking closer.

dialogues.speaker: BLUE MINISKIRT
dialogues.text: Gehhh. Below their high-heeled feet are four giant words - writt red spray paint. Beware the Dog Killer GREEN MINISKIRT flips her foot and grimaces, shaking her with tongue half extended. This really bothers her.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN MINISKIRT
dialogues.text: Lllehhhhehhhaaah. Sam stares at the painted message as he passes the models Yellow Miniskirt looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: YELLOW MINISKIRT
dialogues.text: Really creepy, huh? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: BLUE MINISKIRT
dialogues.text: I don't even walk my dog anymore.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN MINISKIRT
dialogues.text: We use a litter box. Yellow Miniskirt waves her hand in front of her nose.

dialogues.speaker: YELLOW MINISKIRT
dialogues.text: What's that smell?

dialogues.speaker: BLUE MINISKIRT
dialogues.text: I don't know. Sam sniffs himself and makes a face. A loud MECHANICAL SOUND! Sam looks ahead and sees a tow truck lifting his Black Mu onto its flatbed.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What the fuuuuckkk? He starts to sprint, leaving the circle of runway models behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam pounds on the tow truck driver's window. The TOW MAN rolls it down and looks at Sam with a wide an angry mouth.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: That's my car! You can't take my fucking car!

dialogues.speaker: TOW MAN
dialogues.text: This is my job, man. You can't keep it if you don't make the payments. The tow man throws his truck in gear and drives off towar Feliz. Sam watches his car disappear. A homeless woman stares, wheeling a shopping cart along t sidewalk. Squeak! Squeak! Go the wheels.  44 45 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam walks down Griffith Park Boulevard, covered in sweat. He stares at the blank scoreboard near John Marshall High School as he passes. A car full of teenagers zips down the road. Sam hears a familiar tune approach and recede with their passing. You and I... turning like teeth... loving beneath... the surface. Sam listens, wiping sweat from his face. The sun covers a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock. Knock. Knock. COMIC MAN opens his front door and greets Sam - now soake from the heat.

dialogues.speaker: COMIC MAN
dialogues.text: Come on in. You want a beer? He waves Sam inside. Closing the door

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Yes, please.

dialogues.speaker: COMIC MAN
dialogues.text: Hot day and a cold beer. Sam smiles and looks around, fanning himself. It's a mess house. Sketches, papers and books litter the room. Dust balls collect in corners. From the dim living room into the far hallway, the walls covered in LIFE MASKS. Sam fixates on the dozens of solid-white faces hanging everywhere. Their eyes are closed. Their expressions are frozen in time. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He sees... Basil Rathbone, Debbie Reynolds, Angelina Joli Bela Lugosi, Katherine Hepburn, Christopher Reeve, Ashton Kutcher, Linda Blair, Charles Laughton, Patricia Arquette Costello and Robert Redford.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What are these masks?

dialogues.speaker: COMIC MAN
dialogues.text: They're life masks. Comic Man hands Sam a beer. He cracks it open and takes a drink.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What's a life mask?

dialogues.speaker: COMIC MAN
dialogues.text: They're resin castings of famous people's faces. They're all real and they are true to life representations of these amazing people.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Hm.

dialogues.speaker: COMIC MAN
dialogues.text: Most of ‘em are from film productions but some were cast by sculptors for statue construction. Like Lincoln's... Comic Man points to the chalk-white face of Abraham Linco hanging from the wall. His eyelids are closed.

dialogues.speaker: COMIC MAN
dialogues.text: That's his real face... and that's Grace Kelly's right next to Johnny Depp.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Huh.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: I really need to have a family so I have someone to pass these on to. Right? These people need to be remembered.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I understand.  46 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting on the couch, surrounded by books, odd tchotchkes "Under the Silver Lake" zines, Sam draws the double diamo shape on paper. °c Sam's photograph of Sarah sits on the paper next to the drawing. Comic Man leans in and looks at the symbol.

dialogues.speaker: COMIC MAN
dialogues.text: Stay quiet.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: COMIC MAN
dialogues.text: It means "stay quiet". It's a hobo code.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: COMIC MAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Hobos and rail-riders from the 1930's used it. Here look... Comic Man grabs a book from his giant shelf. He opens it shows Sam a graph of common hobo symbols. Oo -- || X r <><> S// Sam lifts a piece of scrap paper from within the book. It filled with handwritten translations. A simple KEY for th mysterious hobo code.

dialogues.speaker: COMIC MAN
dialogues.text: They used it to let other people know who was cool, who wasn't, what houses might offer food, if there's a doctor in that town who might be sympathetic to travelers. That sort of thing. Sam stares at the symbols, keeping the code-filled book m in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Well why is it in Sarah's room and who are they telling to be quiet? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COMIC MAN
dialogues.text: I don't know. Maybe you? Sam takes a deep breath. Comic man opens an issue of "Under the Silver Lake", sitt amongst the clutter. Inside it's filled with snapshots of "lost and found" signs from all over the east side of Los Angeles. Page after page...

dialogues.speaker: COMIC MAN
dialogues.text: There's been a rash of "Lost and Found" signs for dogs, humans, and musical equipment in the past two years. Something big is going on. I know it.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Do you think any of it could be connected to Sarah?

dialogues.speaker: COMIC MAN
dialogues.text: Of course. Sam listens... wanting to believe, but troubled by it all looks at the life masks covering the walls. Is this man sane? Am I? Comic Man begins sorting through various issues of "Under Silver Lake" as he talks.

dialogues.speaker: COMIC MAN
dialogues.text: It could be a lot of things. Sex or drug trafficking. The Dog Killer. Cult of the Whale. I don't know... lately I just assume the Owl's Kiss has something to do with everything.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I'm not so sure about that. Comic Man stares Sam down - a little offended by his dismissal.

dialogues.speaker: COMIC MAN
dialogues.text: Do you have a dollar bill on you?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I might... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sam digs through his wallet and pulls out a dollar. Comic takes it, producing a magnifying glass from the drawer He holds the glass over the dollar bill, steadying it on coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: COMIC MAN
dialogues.text: Take a look... that's the sign of the Owl's Kiss. Sam leans in and looks through the magnifying glass. He s it. A tiny owl is visible, peeking up from behind the cre the top-right corner's numeral one.

dialogues.speaker: COMIC MAN
dialogues.text: Right there. On every dollar bill in this country. With every transaction we enter a pact to live by her law... any household that eats, lives and trades under her eyes is subject to her jurisdiction. Comic Man hands the dollar back to Sam. He stares at the little bird, previously hidden in his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: COMIC MAN
dialogues.text: Our world is filled with codes, pacts user agreements and subliminal messages. More enthusiastic, Comic Man grabs piles of torn magazine pages and ads from old Playboys... waving them in Sam's f

dialogues.speaker: COMIC MAN
dialogues.text: Here... and here... and here... symbols and words hidden in print advertising... Sam sees advertisements with concealed words circled in r Magic marker...

dialogues.speaker: POWER... LOVE... SEX... FREEDOM
dialogues.text: Naked women in the ice cubes of soda pop ads... Women's mouths nearly fellating cheeseburgers... Mae West in the Camel cigarette logo... Dollar Bills hidden in the lettuce... On and on... (CONTINUED)
