dialogues.text: Sam wipes off his milk mustache as he stumbles through a bright aisle of food - milk bottle in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sees a police car parked in Comic Man's driveway. He stares at it, while approaching the front porch. A COP steps out of the backyard, waving Sam away from the house. coP Hey... um... you can't go in there. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What's going on? coP Are you a friend or family?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I just know the guy... not very well... coP The neighbor found him. He committed suicide.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Oh my God. He didn't seem suicidal. The cop debates answering.... coP Ahhhh... I've been in the man's house for two hours. There was something wrong with him. Sam nods. What else can he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Further down the street, Sam hides behind some bushes - s on the police. He watches the cop car pull out of the dri and cruise off. Sam cuts behind some hedges, sneaking into the nearest backyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam pries open Comic Man's kitchen window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam stands in the doorway of the bedroom. The sheets are covered in blood stains. The bed appears wet. Removing the secret panel from the wall, Sam crouches bef the security monitors and VCR. He starts to rewind the tape. Waiting, Sam notices the Moonstones cereal box sitting ne the monitor. He glances at the East Los Angeles map on ba Treasure Hunt! Fun Prizes! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The tape whirls and spins. Sam presses PLAY and watches t security camera footage. An onscreen clock reads:

Dull shots of dim and empty rooms. Nothing happening. Something catches Sam's eye. There's movement on the scre A woman climbs through the side window of the living room feet and legs first. The movement of a dancer

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Ohhhh fuck. Sam watches the monitor - transfixed and disturbed by the image. Onscreen is a beautiful woman - naked except for her owl- cap, red lipstick and overgrown bush. The OWL'S KISS walks carefully, nearly creeping across th living room. She steps out of frame on her way to the bed Sam stares in surprise and a bit of horror He rewinds the tape, watching the Owl's Kiss enter one mo time. A dangling foot connected to a face of taxidermied skin. Sam presses PAUSE - freezing the naked figure mid-step - all her disturbing glory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gripping the old Moonstones cereal box in his hand, Sam r down the street - frightened. He appears more mad than us by the light of day. Sam holds his cell phone up to his ear

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Allen!

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: (over the phone) Hey sir. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I'm fine. Mostly fine. Um... I was wondering if you might know how I can get in touch with Jesus? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: (over the phone) I'm the wrong guy to ask

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: The lead singer from the band.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: (over the phone) No, I know. I'm just fucking with you. What are you doing right now?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Walking home.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: (over the phone) You play chess?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Not well.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: (over the phone) That'11 work. I'll be outside your place in ten minutes. A dog BARKS loudly from behind a fence. Sam steps quickly - eyes darting around the serene neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still in the same clothes, looking sweaty and terrible, S sits in the passenger seat of Allen's beat-up Ford Focus. Allen turns the car, driving into a rich neighborhood off Hillhurst.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: He's just some cable tv actor who likes to have people around... throws these chess parties... with hot chicks and guys who like to play chess. Allen pulls up in front of a modest white mansion near th Greek Theater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BATHING BEAUTY leads Sam and Allen through the large backyard to a small chess table near the pool. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Everyone sits poolside at small tables with chess boards. Pretty girls and handsome guys. Moving Pawns and Pieces. Old school bathing beauties deliver drinks to the players Mimosas and other fun late morning cocktails. A few girls swim in the pool. Aware of their beauty and n concerned with privacy or modesty, they talk and laugh fr Allen moves his Pawn forward. King's Pawn to E4. Sam glan at the board and moves his pawn to A6.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: That's a terrible move. Sam grabs a mimosa from a passing waitress. He sips the d as he scans the yard. Allen stares down at the board, deb and analyzing. Sam sees the Shooting Star girls, both #1 and #2, seated alongside a chess table with two handsome young men. Looking further, he sees Meek Bride and Reading Glasses B sitting Indian-style on the grass - a checkered board and cheese plate between them. In their lace gowns, they are polished bohemian perfection. Then... Sam spots Jesus at a small chess table, engaged i game with the third and last of the Brides - Clara Bow Br Jesus is ever-shirtless. Eternally handsome and miraculou thin. Sam stares for a moment. Debating his next move. Sam notices a RED BALLOON floating over the pool past his view. It's connected to a long ribbon tied to the wrist o Balloon Girl. She's sitting on the far side of the pool, playing a game of chess with Emerald Beauty. Sam waves to Balloon Girl and she smiles in his direction quickly turns her attention back to the game. Allen moves his Knight to F3, nodding to himself, but sti debating his choice. Sam watches as Jesus stands from his chair and walks towa the main house. A lanky and sexual strut. Sam takes a gulp from his mimosa and sets it on the table moving his Knight forward to C6.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I'll be right back. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Allen doesn't look up. He remains fixated on the chess bo particularly Sam's advanced Knight.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: You sure you wanna do that?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Yup. Sam follows Jesus, walking toward the back door of the Mansion. Allen stares at the Pieces and Pawns shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam watches Jesus step into the rear bathroom. He closes old mahogany door. Sam walks straight down the hall, opens the door and step inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus is on the toilet with his pants around his ankles. looks up at Sam.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: What the fuck man?! I'm takin' a shit! Sam says nothing. He closes the door and grabs the skinny by the neck, pushing him onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Get the fuck off me! Sam punches Jesus in the stomach, silencing him quickly. man gasps for air as Sam hovers over him - fists shaking.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Why did you put a code in the song?

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? Two men in a strange position on the bathroom rug.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What are those tunnels for?

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: what? Sam punches Jesus in the face. Jesus almost starts to cry exhaling in rough shakes and fits. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Why are you hitting me? Sam pushes his finger in the emaciated rock star's face.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Your song, "Turning Teeth".... there's a fucking code in it. I wanna know why you put it there and what it means. Jesus says nothing, turning his head away, trying to avoi situation.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Help. Sam grabs his thin arm and bends it backwards, twisting i the elbow.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Fucking tell me! Jesus sobs and writhes in pain.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: I don't know anything about a code. Sam twists harder.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhhh.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: How could you not know? You wrote the fucking song.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: No. I didn't. I wrote most of the songs, but not that one.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Honestly. My label gave me a few songs to record... the rest are all mine.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Which songs did they give you?

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Turning Teeth... Wire Mountains... and Waltz of the Christian Shit Farmers. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rea te cate to reat tate For the taste of yar e~ Coca Cote Wher you ash lor it Be sure you get & ie  96 97 104

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: So all the hits? Jesus looks back - pissed.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: There's no reason to belittle me, man. Sam ignores his reply, twisting him arm back a bit more.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhhh.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: So who wrote the songs?

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: They were delivered anonymously. I got a call from somebody at the label. They weren't bullshitting. They knew everybody and everything that mattered. They said not to ask anyone about it, but that I needed to record the songs or I'd lose my contract. I believed him.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You have no idea who wrote your own hit song? They didn't say anything?

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: He never gave me a name. No. He just said that it was an important piece of music by the songwriter.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Thee songwriter?

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Yeah. The songwriter. Sam considers this for a moment. Jesus stares up at him w tears on his face - his mascara streaking down over his c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near the bath house, Balloon Girl is chatting with Shooti Stars #1 and #2 - all dressed in their cute bathing suits matching shawls. The girls notice Sam approaching fast. H appears hyper-focused and disheveled. Sam grabs Shooting Star #1 by the arm and pulls her aside Balloon Girl and Shooting Star #2 hover nearby - concerne (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Hey...

dialogues.speaker: SHOOTING STAR
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Remember the party you told me about? The gated neighborhood owned by some songwriter? Could you take me there?

dialogues.speaker: SHOOTING STAR
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam walks with the girls, passing by another beautiful ma - a long stretch of perfect green grass. The girls wear t bathing suits and matching shawls. Clickety clacking in t heels. Sam is in yesterday's clothes - sweat stained and soiled.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: So how do you all know each other?

dialogues.speaker: BALLOON GIRL
dialogues.text: We're roommates...

dialogues.speaker: SHOOTING STAR
dialogues.text: And we work together.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: SHOOTING STAR
dialogues.text: We're all Shooting Stars. Sam looks over at Balloon Girl. She strides down the side with young confidence.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (to Balloon Girl) You too?

dialogues.speaker: BALLOON GIRL
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I didn't know you were an actress.

dialogues.speaker: BALLOON GIRL
dialogues.text: I was on a soap opera between the ages of 5 and 6 months. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sam nods - accepting this as common. The gang walks a bit further down the sidewalk

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Are we getting close?

dialogues.speaker: SHOOTING STAR
dialogues.text: It's not far from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and the girls stand before a giant stone wall lining long stretch of some unmarked canyon road. They hug and s their goodbyes. Walking away, Balloon Girl waves to Sam as he begins to c the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peeking out of the trees, Sam sees a wide and perfect sub street. Several giant houses dot the road. No people or c in sight. Sam walks through the neighborhood. It's like a ghost tow passes deserted estate houses moving through the canyon valley... tarp and plastic over furniture and empty parlo rooms. Rounding the bend, Sam sees a large stone mansion at the of the hill - reminiscent of Hearst Castle. Sam sneaks closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam walks around back through the trees discovering a Gre pillared pool and grotto. Towering and enormous windows span the rear of the mansio Looking through the glass, Sam sees a giant vaulted ceili Sweeping arches. An enormous and ornate music hall. In the center of the room is a grand piano. Behind it, si very old and ugly white man. He is the SONGWRITER. The songwriter tilts his head, seeing Sam in the bushes. waves the young man inside. Sam hesitates, but the Songwriter continues to wave him closer. Sam steps out of the grass onto the marble patio near the sparkling blue pool. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He opens the glass doors, and pokes his head into the gra hall.

dialogues.speaker: SONGWRITER
dialogues.text: Come inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keeping his distance, Sam stands near the doorway looking across the room at the old man on the piano bench. The Songwriter has wild grey hair. His skin is cracked an brittle. Old beyond belief. The hall is filled with mirrors, gold and vintage music a like some warped version of Versailles. An oversized poster of a vintage 50's album hangs above t piano: "Julie is her Name".

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You wrote "Turning Teeth" for Jesus and the Brides of Dracula. I know it was you.

dialogues.speaker: SONGWRITER
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: And the code in the music. I found the tunnels... and the bomb shelter

dialogues.speaker: SONGWRITER
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What does it all mean? The Songwriter beckons Sam closer. Directing him to a sma stool facing the piano.

dialogues.speaker: SONGWRITER
dialogues.text: Come and sit down. Here. Sam steps closer, looking at the musical instruments lini the walls and floor. Guitars, a harpsichord, violins ukuleles, etcetera. Sam notices a Sonic Blue Fender Mustang guitar propped on floor stand. He points to it, staring in awe.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Is that Kurt Cobain's Fender Mustang guitar? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SONGWRITER
dialogues.text: Oh I'm not sure. Probably. I don't remember. I have so many things.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Can I pick it up? The Songwriter doesn't care. He shrugs his shoulders. Sur Sam carefully lifts the guitar and sits with it on the st Running his hand along the finish, Sam mumbles and takes of the guitar's neck and bridge. He strums a G chord and up at the old man behind the giant and ornate grand piano

dialogues.speaker: SONGWRITER
dialogues.text: I don't always worry what the message is. I just pass it along... I slip it between the notes... and hide it away for the people who know it's there.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You've done this before? The codes? The Songwriter laughs. He starts to play "Stairway to Hea but transitions into "Macarena"

dialogues.speaker: SONGWRITER
dialogues.text: I wrote most of the music your dad grew up on, half of what you sang along to as a kid, and I'm still doin' it. These teenagers are dancing to myyyy music. Sam sees clear tubes running into the old man's nostrils connected to a silver canister marked with Japanese lette

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You're telling me that there are messages hidden in old pop songs?

dialogues.speaker: SONGWRITER
dialogues.text: Movies and television shows... everything you know.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Why? The songwriter ignores Sam. Humming along to a few random chords. Is that the theme song to "The Facts of Life"?

dialogues.speaker: SONGWRITER
dialogues.text: Pop culture. Ugh. It floats away like tissue paper. I blow my nose. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SONGWRITER (cont'd) I find an old Kleenex, I recycle it. It becomes your wedding song. The old man taps a few notes from "I Want to Know What Lo Is".

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What are the tunnels for? Is there gonna be a war? The Songwriter looks away, playing "In-A-Gadda-Da-Vida" a the piano keys.

dialogues.speaker: SONGWRITER
dialogues.text: I don't know. I'm just trying to make a living. Earn a few dollars. Sam looks around at the luxurious space.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: But you have everything. The Songwriter is quiet for a moment. He looks out at the trees against the hillside.

dialogues.speaker: SONGWRITER
dialogues.text: No. Sam pulls out the photo of Sarah. He holds it up for the Songwriter to see.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Did you know this girl? The old man leans forward and looks at the picture. He sh his head.

dialogues.speaker: SONGWRITER
dialogues.text: She's pretty.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: She was killed along with Jefferson Sevence. But I think you knew that.

dialogues.speaker: SONGWRITER
dialogues.text: I didn't. The Songwriter slams his hands down forming a low and resonating chord - letting it ring out. He plays another chord, slowly beginning to sing something resembling a fu dirge. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SONGWRITER
dialogues.text: (singing) Mulattoooo. Albinoooo. Mosquitoooo. Libidoooo. Sam stares at the man in horror. He glances down at the priceless guitar in his own hands.

dialogues.speaker: SONGWRITER
dialogues.text: I don't care what's fashionable or cool. It's all silly and meaningless. I've created so many of the things that you care about... the songs that give your life purpose and joy. When you were fifteen and rebelling... you did that to my music. The Songwriter holds up his fingers and moves them like s legs - simultaneously playing the notes to Nirvana's "Sme Like Teen Spirit" with his other hand. Plink plink. Plink Plink plink

dialogues.speaker: SONGWRITER
dialogues.text: It wasn't written on a distorted guitar... I wrote it... ona piano...here... in between a blowjob and an omelette. There's no rebellion. There's only me... earning a paycheck.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I don't believe you.

dialogues.speaker: SONGWRITER
dialogues.text: Good. The real message was never intended for you. It's better if you just smile and dance. Enjoy the melody. The man plays more music, pointing to his chest.

dialogues.speaker: SONGWRITER
dialogues.text: This ugly old man, me, I'm the voice of your generation, your grandparent's, your parent's and the young people who follow you. Sam stares in horror. He doesn't want to believe.

dialogues.speaker: SONGWRITER
dialogues.text: It's funny... all the things you hope for, and dreeeeam about being a part of... they're all a fabrication. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 102 CONTINUED: (4) “102 SONGWRITER (cont'd) Your art, your writing, your culture is the shell of other men's ambitions. Ambitions beyond what you will ever understand.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: That's funny to you?

dialogues.speaker: SONGWRITER
dialogues.text: A little. The old man coughs and wheezes - dancing his fingers merr across the keyboard - performing a quick mad mixture of B Jesus and the Brides, Buddy Holly, N.W.A. and The Rolling Stones.

dialogues.speaker: SONGWRITER
dialogues.text: I wrote this... and this... that... and this too...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Stop it. The Songwriter laughs. His cackling along with the plinki keys of the grand piano echoes through the gigantic hall.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Who paid you to write these songs? The Songwriter smiles and nods as he reaches into his poc He lifts up a small HANDGUN, aiming it at Sam's head.

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: The bullet misses Sam as he tumbles sideways to the floor.Cobain's guitar falling on his lap. With a single hand, the Songwriter begins to play "What's Frequency Kenneth". He laughs and hums the melody.

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: Sam dodges a second shot, ducking down below the piano.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What are the tunnels for?! BANG! Another bullet flies by his head. The music still p

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Tell me what happened to Sarah! Sam charges the old man, raising the guitar over his head an axe. We hear the roar of guitar feedback. Warped notes (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: The bullet zips past Sam's ear as he swings the faded turquoise guitar down onto the Songwriter's head.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH
dialogues.text: Bone cracks under the weight of maple and basswood. The songwriter's skull crumbles. Brain matter lands on the iv keys. Distortion rumbles. Sam swings it again, breaking the neck of the guitar from body... wire strings messily join the two pieces. The woo base hangs down like some holy instrument destroyed befor crowd by Townshend, Hendrix or Cobain. Sam stands over the old man. He drops the broken guitar, breathing deeply. The music room is quiet. Frightened, Sam picks up the gun from the floor and stuff into his jeans. He runs out the back door, leaving the ro empty and still. The Songwriter lays motionless near the piano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam leans out his patio door, drinking a beer - visibly shaken. The wind blows through his hair. A dark pink sky is visible over the rooftops. Rain clouds approach. Lightning snaps across the horizon, followed by the low rumble of thunder The neighbor's bird CAWS loudly. On the television, an old movie plays. It's the 1956 vers of "Invasion of the Body Snatchers". Kevin McCarthy runs across the I-5 overpass screaming. Cars cruise along, ign his crazed warning.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN MCCARTHY
dialogues.text: (on television) You fools! You're in danger! Can't you see?! They're after you! They're after all of us! Our wives, our children everyone! They're here already! You're next! You're next! You're next!  113.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 105 The gas lamps that line the garden walkway offer dim pool orange light. Sam walks slowly through the apartment comp twisting paths. The trickle of running water through the stream follows h footsteps. Sam sips an iced latte, carrying an LA Weekly under his a Jesus and the Brides of Dracula pose on the cover. The partially obscured headline reads:

dialogues.speaker: JESUS PREDICTS... BAD TIMES AHEAD
dialogues.text: A DIRTY HUMAN FACE peers out from within a bush - disturb low to the ground like a cat or possum. Eyes watch Sam as passes - he doesn't notice. Leaves and branches rattle above. A squirrel falls from the tree in front of Sam. It hits t concrete, and partially splatters on the ground. The squirrel tries to move but it's mortally injured. Sam stares in horror at the small animal. Is it trying to say something? Sam backs away from it and rushes down the path. He turns corner. Before him stands a shadowy figure in the center of the g walkway. Stepping closer, Sam sees more clearly. It is a two-dimensional black cardboard figure of a man stabbing a cardboard dog. Sam approaches the cut-out stan tips it over with his finger It lands on the ground with a soft tap - like a leaf comi rest on the forest floor. Glass shatters!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam lifts his head from the damp pillow. Rain pours again the bedroom window. Thunder rumbles - long and steady. A cascade of lightning illuminates the messy bedroom - th Playboys on the floor. Issue July 1970. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sam hears glass breaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam steps into the living room with pistol in hand. He se hole in the glass of the sliding door... it's now half op The storm breeze moves across the blinds, blowing his paperwork across the carpet. The pages of "Code Breakers" "Spider Man" flip wildly. He moves closer to the patio. A careful step. Then anothe Behind Sam, a small cabinet door opens quietly. Long bare fold out from within - like the appendages of an insect - flesh stretches. Now fully emerged from the tight space, the OWL'S KISS st behind Sam with a kitchen knife in her hand. Sam turns and sees the naked woman in her owl-skin mask. jumps back as she silently sprints down the hall into his bedroom. The door closes. Sam stares in shock at the closed bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam enters the room carefully, peeking inside with the gu He turns on the bedroom light. She's not here. Sam checks under the bed... in the closet... nothing. Lightning flashes. A coyote HOWLS in the distance. Tense. Sam opens his dresser drawer. The gun angled down toward his socks and underwear Knock! Knock! Knock! Sam turns toward the sound...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock! Knock! Knock! Knock! Sam looks through the peep hole and sees a Los Angeles Sh on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (whispers to himself) Fuck. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He holds his dizzy head as the air leaves his lungs in ex Sam tries to breathe as he opens the door. Resigned to whatever happens. His shoulders slump. In the hallway, alongside the SHERIFF, stands the greasy haired apartment Manager. His face is puckered and sour

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Hi, I'm here to inform you that you have to evacuate the premises immediately.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Oh... This is about my rent? Sam seems relieved for a moment. It could be worse.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Yes. You haven't paid. It's...

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Criminally overdue. Sam takes a step closer to the Sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Is there any way I could have a couple more days?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: No. I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Please. I don't have anywhere to go. I'm close to getting the money. I promise I am.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Listen... I don't like this either Worst part of my job, ok?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: I can give you two more days... but that's it. If you can't pay I will not be the nice guy you see right now. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Manager wears a heavy scowl - irritated by the office leniency.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: I want him out today. The Sheriff turns to the angry Manager.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Hey! I'm taking care of this. Don't be greedy. The Manager nods his head as the Sheriff looks back at Sa

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Two days. He holds up two fingers in front of his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain has stopped. Water drips from the eaves. Sam smokes on the patio listening to the parrot caw. A garbage can falls over.

dialogues.speaker: RATTLE CLANG
dialogues.text: Sam looks down toward the pool and sees a small COYOTE di through the trash. It stares up at him. The animal turns and walks down the sidewalk. Sam watches intensely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing his white undershirt and pajama pants, Sam follow coyote down the street. The coyote glances back at him, then scampers along. Down Griffith Park Boulevard... Past apartments and condos... Into the hillside neighborhood... Expensive homes... Beautiful cars... Things you can't possess... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sam follows the wild animal through the streets. He stare at the world around him. Voices and laughter within the h Families together in front of giant televisions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coyote runs up the DRIVEWAY of a LARGE SILVERLAKE HOM disappears into the trees. Sam stands in front of the house and looks through the fr window. People are everywhere. A big party is taking plac Music pours from inside. Sam notices a familiar face in profile through the pictur window. It is Millicent Sevence. She disappears into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam walks through the party in his damp white undershirt. scans the crowd for Millicent. He passes a myriad of conversations. We hear only pieces them. Sam moves deeper, bumping shoulders as he cranes his neck trying to look above it all.

dialogues.speaker: FACELESS PARTY GOER
dialogues.text: It's such a cliche! Being special isn't special anymore. It's just so obvious. The real trick is to find a way to be unimportant but still get noticed. Sam passes through the swarming patches of conversation a networking. A COMPLIMENTING WOMAN notices Sam's shirt as walks by.

dialogues.speaker: COMPLIMENTING WOMAN
dialogues.text: Oh I like your shirt. Sam looks down at his lightly stained, old, Hanes sleep s He tugs at the cotton. Moving deeper, Sam walks by the PARTY HOST. She's engaged conversation with a pretty woman. Sam recognizes her... i Chesty Woman... the girl he spied via the drone's video f (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PARTY HOST
dialogues.text: I really want to become a professional vagabond. Travel the entiiiiire world.

dialogues.speaker: CHESTY WOMAN
dialogues.text: Pleeeeease... bring me along.

dialogues.speaker: PARTY HOST
dialogues.text: I'd love to. You can be my photographer. The aspiring travelers laugh together. Sam turns and spin looking for Millicent. Nearby, GOSSIPING MAN engages in conversation with GOSSIP WOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: GOSSIPING MAN
dialogues.text: (pointing at girl) That girl is the youngest woman to ever write, produce, direct and sound design her own network sitcom. Gossiping Man casually points to a twelve-year-old girl e cake, surrounded by young adults and two security men in suits. She's the ADOLESCENT PRODIGY.

dialogues.speaker: GOSSIPING WOMAN
dialogues.text: How old is she?

dialogues.speaker: GOSSIPING MAN
dialogues.text: Twelve, but she's clearly an old soul. The Gossiping Woman nods her head, glancing back at the Adolescent Prodigy as the young girl giggles and rudely s her finger in her nose.

dialogues.speaker: GOSSIPING MAN
dialogues.text: Honestly... she's really captured the zeitgeist. I don't think any adult could ever express the kind of deep understanding that she has over her material.

dialogues.speaker: GOSSIPING WOMAN
dialogues.text: I'm embarrassed I haven't seen it yet.

dialogues.speaker: GOSSIPING MAN
dialogues.text: You should be. A beautiful Indian woman bumps into Sam. He turns and loo into her eyes. It's the girl from the Contact Lens Billbo (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She looks back at Sam - holding hands with a very HANDSOM in a tailored suit. Her name, for the sake of this story, EX.

dialogues.speaker: EX
dialogues.text: Um. Hey. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I'm good.

dialogues.speaker: EX
dialogues.text: I'm really glad to hear that. The beautiful woman offers Sam an honest and heartfelt lo He's silenced by her sincerity.

dialogues.speaker: EX
dialogues.text: Uh... this is my fiance. Sam looks over, fumbles, then shakes hands with the Hands Man.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Oh. Hello. Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: HANDSOME MAN
dialogues.text: Thank you. Ex nervously twirls her finger through her hair

dialogues.speaker: EX
dialogues.text: Yes, thank you. Sam nods and smiles, waiting for it to end.

dialogues.speaker: EX
dialogues.text: So... how's... work?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Oh. It's ok. His face doesn't sell the lie. The beautiful woman plays anyway.

dialogues.speaker: EX
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I saw your... billboard.

dialogues.speaker: EX
dialogues.text: Oh cool. Which one? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: There's more than one? The girl grins and nods her head - a long and awkward mom

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: On Los Feliz near Bigfoot.

dialogues.speaker: EX
dialogues.text: Cool. Cool. I'm glad it's gettin' out there. You know... always workin' hard. Gotta keep tryin'

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Yup. Same here. Handsome Man squeezes her hand gently. Ex glances over, t steps towards Sam to offer a quick goodbye hug.

dialogues.speaker: EX
dialogues.text: Well... it was great seeing you.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Yeah. Yeah. You too. Sam watches Ex walk away with Handsome Man. In the distance, he sees Millicent stepping into a nearby room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Millicent stands before a beautiful flower painting. She focuses on it. Sam steps alongside her and admires the petunia painting tandem.

dialogues.speaker: MILLICENT
dialogues.text: It's beautiful, right?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: It is.

dialogues.speaker: MILLICENT
dialogues.text: Do you know who painted it?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: MILLICENT
dialogues.text: Gaynor. Janet Gaynor. The actress. Sam looks back at Millicent with a bright expression. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Oh. My mom likes her.

dialogues.speaker: MILLICENT
dialogues.text: I like her too. Sam nods and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MILLICENT
dialogues.text: You know who I am?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Yeah. There's a sadness about Millicent that Sam suddenly recognizes. A soft tone guides their encounter.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I was friends with one of the girls that was with your dad. She was a nice person.

dialogues.speaker: MILLICENT
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I've been trying to find out what happened to her.

dialogues.speaker: MILLICENT
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: MILLICENT
dialogues.text: Do you know anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WATER within the RESERVOIR is calm, reflecting the mo glow. A few ducks quack and drift along as herons fly overhead. Sam and Millicent walk together along the outer fence tha surrounds the giant water reserve.

dialogues.speaker: MILLICENT
dialogues.text: What do you think it all means?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I don't know. I can't see it yet. But I'm close... I think. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They step together in unison over the remaining puddles f the evening rain storm. Near the fence, Sam and Millicent pass a DOG MEMORIAL com with a BRONZE DOG STATUE and a plaque. Photos of deceased dogs and puppies are taped to the fenc Victims of the Dog Killer Flowers cover the ground around it. Paper signs with handwritten messages surround the photos We miss you Fluffy Benny was the best dog a man ever had Mr. Spot R.I.P. God will judge you, dog killer! Sam and the young woman slow down before the odd little memorial. Millicent reacts with pain at the discovery of dog's expression. Pictures of the dead.

dialogues.speaker: MILLICENT
dialogues.text: I don't know if we should be walking around here at night.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I think we're safe. We don't have a dog with us.

dialogues.speaker: MILLICENT
dialogues.text: Yeah, but anybody who could kill a dog wouldn't think twice about killing a person.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I'm not sure that's true. They walk a bit further. Sam reaches over and takes Millicent's hand in his own.

dialogues.speaker: MILLICENT
dialogues.text: Are you a dog or a cat person?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Eh... It's hard to say. I got bit by my grandparents' terrier when I was a kid. I guess they kinda scare me a little bit. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MILLICENT
dialogues.text: That's terrible. I like dogs... but cats are good too.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Yeah. They walk further, looking out at the water across the reservoir. Moonlight and stars reflect against the mirror surface of the man-made lake. Sam look at Millicent's gentle and beautiful face. She lo back at him with a nearly imperceptible grin. They share moment of connection. Unspoken, and stronger for it. Two small figures under a dark sky - rounding the giant l Up ahead, a LONG HAIRED WINO sits against the fence. As S and Millicent approach, he leans forward and shouts.

dialogues.speaker: LONG HAIRED WINO
dialogues.text: Haaahh! ! Sam glares at the man, moving Millicent to the outer edge the sidewalk. Street chivalry.

dialogues.speaker: LONG HAIRED WINO
dialogues.text: Got a little change? Sam looks down. Irritated by the question. Disgusted by t man.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (resentful) Nope. Sorry. Sam avoids the man's feet, extended onto the walkway - an intentional obstacle.

dialogues.speaker: LONG HAIRED WINO
dialogues.text: No money to spare, huh? Does the lady know you're cheap?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: LONG HAIRED WINO
dialogues.text: Ugly ass piece of shit worthless trash motherfucker. You're more broke than I am. Fuck you! I'll kill you, cock sucker. Come back here and sit down next to poppa. I'll shit in your mouth. Asshole fuckin' dickwad, piece o' shit, son of a bitch.... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sam and the pretty girl walk away from the homeless man - in hand. A beautiful evening stroll. Long Haired Wino continues to curse in the distance. Shou like an animal.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (speaking softly) I know it's not ok to say this, but I really fucking hate the homeless. Everyone says they need our help but I think they're bullies. They're like... poltergeists.

dialogues.speaker: MILLICENT
dialogues.text: You mean ghosts?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Yeah... all they do is float around on the periphery... watching people eat tasty food, drink beer and be in love... and they can't participate... so they get jealous and harass us. Millicent raises her brow.

dialogues.speaker: MILLICENT
dialogues.text: Maybe just give 'em a dollar next time? Sam takes a breath and looks back - still angry about the encounter. Millicent says nothing, smiling in response to Sam's overreaction. She looks towards the reservoir

dialogues.speaker: MILLICENT
dialogues.text: Have you ever been in there? Millicent points to the serene water beyond the fence.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: In the reservoir?

dialogues.speaker: MILLICENT
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Eh eh. Millicent starts to climb the fence. Designer shoes scuff through the chain links. Delicate hands pulling her highe (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sam stands there, watching. She looks down at him - a gia grin on her face. A pretty girl hanging from a fence like cat.

dialogues.speaker: MILLICENT
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing at the edge of the concrete water basin, Millice and Sam take off their clothes. Now in the water, the pair swim toward the center of the reservoir. Quietly. Knowing glances between them. Naked b just below the surface. House lights are visible against the hillside landscape a them. A dark sea in the backyards of people's homes. This is sacred territory and they both feel it. Treading water in the middle of the reservoir, Sam and Millicent face each other - occasionally looking up and o at the dark hills which cup them like hands holding bath water. The night sky, the stars and the moon settle along the su of the lake. Millicent moves in. Closer to Sam. She nuzzles her cheek against his neck. Hands touching skin under the water. She kisses his ear. Whispering very close and quiet...

dialogues.speaker: MILLICENT
dialogues.text: (whispering) I think someone is following me.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (whispering) Are you kidding?

dialogues.speaker: MILLICENT
dialogues.text: (whispering) I wanted it to look like we're here to screw.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (whispering) We're not? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MILLICENT
dialogues.text: (whsipering) I found something hidden in my dad's office. Under the water, Millicent pulls a silver bracelet off he wrist and slips it onto Sam's arm. He raises his forearm along the surface of the water and stares at the circular band. It looks like Sarah's bracel inscriptions of small letters and numbers etched within t silver. NPM 1 35 to 37 - C3 to E6 Sam focuses on the inscription.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: C3 to E6. Sounds like a chess move. Did your dad play chess?

dialogues.speaker: MILLICENT
dialogues.text: He did. Pop! Water splashes in front of them. A bullet hitting the wat silenced shot from the dark shore.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What the... Tiny splashes appear along the surface of the lake over Millicent's shoulder. Quiet gunfire. Pop! Pop!

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Get under the water. Sam takes a giant breath and dives down beneath the surfa He pulls on Millicent's arm, but they're separated in the chaos. Deeper he goes. Bubbles and swirling liquid blur Sam's vision. He swims u the water as bullets spread around him - diving like peng Sam sees her... Dropping... Through the blue water... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Millicent sinks down past Sam - on her back - blood strea up from a small hole in her naked chest. Bubbles pour fro red lips. She appears to stare at us, but it's hard to sa Her hands cover her breasts, unknowingly mirroring Sam's treasured Playboy cover. July 1970. A beautiful woman. His earliest fantasy. Dropping into th depths of the reservoir Sam is overwhelmed by the terrible sight. Water pours off his body as he climbs up the concrete embankment along the edge of the lake. Naked and frantic, Sam reaches the fence and climbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam walks quickly down the garden path - still naked and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam wakes up. Naked on his living room carpet. The silver bracelet around his wrist. He stares at the inscription around the band, twisting it his hand. The sun is bright through the open patio door.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: C3 to E6. C3 to E6? The neighbor's parrot CAWS from across the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nawwwwwddduuumeennndd Sam stares at the bracelet.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (under his breath) What the fuck are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam opens an old Milton Bradley chess box. He flips the b out and grabs his black Sharpie marker

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: C3... to... Sam circles the square C3 on the chess board - drawing an arrow towards E6 across the checkered boxes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oo ee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a fa a Ba h1 abcdefgh

dialogues.speaker: E6.
dialogues.text: Sam circles the E6 square with his marker. He stares at the board, spinning it around on the carpet. does it means?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Hm. Sam looks back at the bracelet.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: NPM 1 35 to 37. NPM. NPM. What the fuck is NPM? Sam sits with his laptop, typing the letters NPM into Goo Search. He scans the resulting page... nothing makes sense.

dialogues.speaker: N. P.M.
dialogues.text: Sam runs his hands through his messy hair in frustration. looks across the carpet and sees the old Nintendo Entertainment System. An idea sparks. Reaching across the floor, Sam grabs a stack of Nintendo Magazines. He sorts through the covers, finding the first issue. Mar smiles, leaping from a mushroom - a carrot in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: NPM issue number one. Fuck. The pages fly past us like a piece of animation, flipped across Sam's thumb. He settles on pages 35, 36 and 37. It's a subdivided map from "The Legend of Zelda". Sam smi as he notices the alphanumeric grids that cover the map. circles the squares corresponding to C3 and E6.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What the fuck do I do with this? Outside, the parrot CACKLES. Children splash in the pool. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee eee ook eee esl Vielen ee ee es Sit) eee ae] “1 ST el oe ae Cee aa ee en oe saan pam —+ Se eeiediiil Keele

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sam looks across the room and notices the Moonstones cere box sitting on the counter. He runs to it. Tearing it open, he tastes one of the cereal bites. Repul by the ancient stale food, he spits it onto the floor as digs deeper into the box with a single hand. From the bottom, he pulls out a prize. A plastic-wrapped transparency-map of Los Angeles covered with Moonstone characters and bright colors. He opens the wrapper and pulls out the map... Holding the cartoon map of LA over the Zelda map, Sam rea that they line up perfectly. E6 corresponds to the Silverlake reservoir

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: So that's the reservoir. And... C3 is a wooded section of Mt. Hollywood.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Mt. Hollywood? Sam opens google maps and brings up the Los Angeles overh map. He zooms in. Tighter and tighter on the rear section Mt. Hollywood. A small square of forest is BLACKED OUT. A solid graphic marked with text: Satellite Image Unavailable Sam stares at the small hidden square. He hits his hand d against the couch.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What the fuck is in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam races up the path along the LA river on an old BMX bi He's wearing a red hoodie over his head, looking like a m child from a Steven Spielberg movie. He stands on the pedals and lifts his head into the wind looking toward the tall green hills beyond the river He pedals faster. A man on a bicycle heading toward adven

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: — to _— > e+ 7| ee: a: es ee Ms Do t=] ok | em RS [cS BS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 121 122 123 Sam hikes through the woods, trudging up the hillside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam reaches the tall wooden fence. He notices several pai marks along the wall.

Three parallel lines - diagonal from the top to the botto the wall. What does that mean? Sam opens his wallet and pulls out a piece of scrap paper filled with handwritten translations of Hobo Code. It's the paper "key" created by Comic Man. Sam runs his finger over the symbols, stopping alongside three parallel lines. The hobo translations is: this is not a safe place

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaching a clearing, Sam steps through the trees and look ahead. He sees a single straw hut in the middle of an overgrown field. A few Alberto Giacometti human-figure sculptures stand li scarecrows within the grass. An eerie expression of the emaciated human form. Tall or short... all with appendage like twigs. Sam walks toward the straw hut, checking the gun tucked i his waist band. He hears water splashing from inside. Delicately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arriving at the doorway of the hut, Sam looks inside. He fifty-nine-year-old man in a white gown, crouched on the floor. This man, the FINAL MAN, is washing the feet of three you women in white rags. Sam recognizes their faces as they l up from their seated positions along the wood floor. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It's Troy, Fannie, and Mae. The girls in the White Rabbit

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Hello? The Final Man turns and faces Sam. He remains sitting Ind style in the center of the straw hut. The three beautiful young women sitting in a row along the wall.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: Hello. Silence. Sam waits for something to happen.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Um... yeah. The girls cock their inquisitive heads as Sam clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: My friend Sarah was killed. These girls know something about it.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: Why do you assume that?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I saw her taking things from Sarah's apartment. Sam points at Troy. She smiles as his finger singles her

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I found a code in their friend's song. I've been in the tunnels.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: Alright. The Final Man calmly pours several cups of tea into tiny porcelain containers. He passes them out to the girls - t one for himself.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: Please sit down. Drink with us. Sam sits against the wall, staring at the man and his tri harem. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I found a bunker down there. Some kind of shelter in case of a nuclear war.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: It's not a shelter.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What is it then? The Final Man places a small cup of tea on the floor in f of Sam.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: A tomb.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What? Mae's face brightens with excitement. She looks to the Fi Man.

dialogues.speaker: MAE
dialogues.text: Was it ours? The Man pats Mae on the leg - a comforting "I'll be with in a moment" gesture.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: They're tombs. For kings... like me. Like Jefferson Sevence. The girls begin to drink their tea.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Why would Jefferson Sevence need a tomb underneath the city? The Final Man glances over at his Ascension Brides. He ma face to them - suggesting that Sam doesn't "get it". Troy grins back in adoration.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: A cemetery isn't good enough? Sam glares at them all - growing more irritated with thei smug and holy demeanor.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: It's not about burial. It's about ascension. We're not dying, we're being transported to another world. Somewhere better than this. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As the Final him from his face.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Are you talking about heaven?

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: You'd have to be a fool to think that poverty in this life equals wealth in the next. I'm talking about something exclusive and real. Our souls will be pulled from our bodies and carried through the unfathomable amniotic sac that holds us here and prevents us from true connection. Man describes the birth-like barrier separating bliss, he tugs at his cheeks - the skin on his

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: We will be beyond this universe and living together as kings without limitation. The pharoahs did it... great men throughout history have done the same. Sam stares at the man, trying to make sense of it.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Are you dying? The man shakes his head, smiling at the course of Sam's ignorant interrogation.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: I'm about to be sealed inside a tomb with my beautiful brides... The Final Man waves his hand, presenting his future wives

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: . and all my worldly treasures. We'll have delicious meals and wine and television and sex. Enough to last us for six months.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: And then you die? The Final Man gulps his tea in a single shot - setting th back on the tray.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: No. We wait to be ascended. Our souls and all the gold I've managed to collect will be transported. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FINAL MAN (cont'd) Enough to buy ourselves a position of royalty in a world of perfection and beauty. Sam stares in disbelief. This is madness of course.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: Only the richest of men can afford this ceremony. I'm not even gonna tell you how many people you have to kill for just one man... and three women... He glances back at his grateful brides.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: . to reach the afterlife. The requirements for sacrifice are so specific... hair color, age, sex, tooth alignment, dietary habits, cancer formations... it takes a fortune and and an army to catalog these people and kill them according to ritual.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Who did you kill?

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: It's expensive to build a tunnel system and keep it hidden, but it costs even more to murder people and not be harassed about it. The infrastructure, the management, the bribery... all in the name of something holy and pure.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Did you kill Sarah? The Final Man pulls a bamboo framed photo off the wall ne the doorway. He offers it up to Sam.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: No one will find our chambers for a thousand years. Future men will understand that we were the modern kings. Rulers without statues or effigies. Looking at the photo, Sam sees Jefferson Sevence in a whi gown - his arms around Sarah and her two roommates in whi rags. All sitting together within this very same straw sh Wide smiles across their faces. No fear or terror (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: They were here? Looking closer, Sam notices that Sarah's "How to Marry a Millionaire" dolls are visible on the floor behind her

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Is Sarah alive?

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: She may have ascended already. I don't know. Sam points downward - growing more disgusted and horrifie with each revelation.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: She's in one of those tombs? Fannie nods her head - a big smile of anticipation across face.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: With Sevence?

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: But they found his body.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: They found another man's bones mixed with... most of Jefferson's teeth, some of his skin, and all the organs that he's able to live without. Sam is taken aback - horrified by it all - a swirling sic in his head. The white robed host and hostesses observe Sam as his breathing changes - sweat forms on his skin.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: (signaling quotation marks with his hands) Did you think "heaven" was easy? Sam looks down at his lap. He's unable to focus.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I never gave it much thought. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ci Most Glamorous Eien Of Your Lifetime E INEmMaScOP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ) Se TT uh nunwacey JOHNSON) TeAN in NEGULESCO wriaer JOHNSON:  136.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: And what do you think now?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I think you're gonna bury yourself alive. You're gonna run out of food and you're gonna fucking eat each other and die. After that... I have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: I doubt that it will be so grim, but even if it is... it'll be worth it. The Final man looks around the room in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: All this ugliness is just a cocoon. Sam's eyes flare with anger. He's had enough.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH
dialogues.text: He pounds his fist into the wall, knocking several photos ceremonial statues to the floor The Final Man and his Brides are momentarily startled. Th watch Sam as he exhales deeply, regaining his composure.

dialogues.speaker: MAE
dialogues.text: (whispering to herself) That's such an angry thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: (calm) What are you upset about?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I just... want to see Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: Ok. Well... let's see if we can get her on the phone. Spinning around in his seat, the Final Man opens up a bam panel, revealing a flat-screen monitor and corded telepho receiver. He presses some buttons and waits - listening i to the earpiece.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: They have a phone? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: Incoming calls only. We've had problems in the past. People getting scared... trying to get out.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: They're trapped? The phone continues to ring - very quietly from the recei Static on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: (speaking in a half- whisper as one does when on the phone) We wouldn't want to lose out on eternal life just because we might have a normal physical aversion to being buried underneath the earth. We're only human. There's a light click - a voice on the line - unheard by

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: Hello, how are you? (beat) Uh huh. Ok good. (beat) Do you mind if I put you on video phone? A friend of yours is here. He wants to see you. (beat) Ok. Great. The Final Man presses another button and the television flickers on, revealing a beautiful young woman's face. It is Sarah - looking straight at us through the video sc She appears calm, comfortably covered in a simple summer dress, holding the telephone up to her cheek. Behind her is a cavernous, brightly-lit living room. Rock formations hang from the ceiling, alongside a diamond encrusted chandelier. One of Sarah's roommates, the Brunette, is sitting naked lazy-boy chair - her legs propped up before a giant telev screen. She's brushing her teeth - spitting into a small golden chalice. Jefferson Sevence is sitting on the couch, nestled up aga Sarah's blond roommate. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They're watching an old episode of The Andy Griffith Show TV Land - sharing a bowl of popcorn. A mountain of gold bars lines the far wall. The Final Man hands Sam the telephone. He holds it up to ear.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Sarah? Can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah. Hellooo.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I've been looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You hardly know me.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Are you annoyed with me? You angry?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Do I sound angry?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Kinda.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I just wanted to know what happened to you.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Do you really want to stay down there?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You're gonna die down there. Is that what you want? Sarah stares into the televison screen - deep in thought. face displays a range of feelings. Joy. Fear. Doubt. Sarah looks back at Jefferson and her roommates - all lau before the giant television.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I'm gonna take this in the bedroom. She holds the phone out towards her Brunette Roommate.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Will you hang it up when I get in there?

dialogues.speaker: BRUNETTE ROOMMATE
dialogues.text: Sure. The Brunette gets out of her chair and takes the phone as Sarah exits our view. The naked Brunette stands there. She half-listens into th piece - bored - with her hand on her waist. A finger twis the curly chord. The Final Man looks over at Sam. He leans close and whisp

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: (whispering to Sam) Their chamber was covered with a mountain of concrete. It can't be opened. There's no point in upsetting the girl. Please be kind. CLICK. The screen switches to a view of an ornate underground bedroom. Sarah sits on the floor staring at the camera wi the phone to her ear.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I got it!

dialogues.speaker: BRUNETTE ROOMMATE
dialogues.text: Ok. There's another CLICK as the Brunette hangs up the line. Sarah looks up at the screen into Sam's eyes. Her voice i softer now - an unsure whisper (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (meek and quiet) Do you think I made a mistake? Coming down here? Sam looks at the Final Man before responding.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Maybe. Sarah exhales with a vocal sigh, stretching her arm out i frustration.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Ehhhhhhh. She shakes off the bad feelings.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Well there's no getting out, so I may as well make the best of things, huh?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Yeah... Sam looks away from the tv monitor and stares through the doorway into the outside world.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Same here. Sarah nods at the screen, fidgeting with her dress. Takin moment to herself.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: So... how are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Not great.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Have you thought about getting another dog?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It might be good for you. A little unconditional love.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I'll think about it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Um... I should probably get going. I said I'd make dinner tonight. I have a million things to do.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Ok. Well enjoy your dinner.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Thanks. Take care.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Bye. Sarah places her receiver down as the Final Man turns off monitor. He takes the phone away from Sam.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: 0k? Sam nods. His face is pale. He picks up his cup of tea an takes a sip. Mae reaches out and holds hands with the other Ascension Brides. She looks between them and the Final Man - now ignoring Sam.

dialogues.speaker: MAE
dialogues.text: Last night... I had a vision of us making love beneath the earth, then swimming together naked in a dark pool. And that's when it happens... our bodies dissolve into light and every beautiful thought we've ever had forms around us and carries our souls through space to another world... and we're just laughing the whole time because we know that nothing can ever be wrong again. Mae turns to Sam.

dialogues.speaker: MAE
dialogues.text: I wish you were coming with us. Sam gulps the rest of his tea. He sets the cup onto the f The Final Man looks over at Sam.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: This isn't a world that anybody with any sense stays in or spends much time worrying about. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sam watches as Fannie falls over into the lap of her near friend.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: Your goals... your dreams... the things that eat away your life before your eyes... you're living ina carnival, throwing plastic rings at oversized pop bottles hoping to win a prize... Troy lays back against the wall and closes her eyes. Mae into a little ball on the floor

dialogues.speaker: FINAL MAN
dialogues.text: What do you win? A 2 week vacation? A new car? Maybe a little money to retire on? It's all a shitty, sawdust filled rabbit. The things you care about are useless where we're going. Sam stares ahead as the Final Man slumps over, landing on girls' slack bodies. His head rests on Mae's thigh. Sam tries to stand. He touches his face and stumbles to t side. Falling down. His head on the wooden floor. Mouth a Sam watches the orange sun cross the skyline beyond the t It's beautiful outside. Through the open doorway, Sam sees a grass-covered hatch in the middle of the field. The Homeless King emerges from under the ground. Calmly, he walks to the hut and stops at the entrance, lo down at Sam. The Homeless King leans on the door frame, back-lit again the LA sun, posing like a mock-John-Wayne. Waiting. Patie Sam tries to lift his face.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: How did you you know I was here?

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS KING
dialogues.text: We smelled you.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Oh. Sam rests his head on the cool wooden tile. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Everything goes black once more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam opens his eyes. He's chained to a chair in a small concrete room. No windows. Very dark. The homeless king stands before him - blocking the stone doorway. Sam takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What happened to that man? And those girls?

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS KING
dialogues.text: They're waking up right now. In their ascension chamber.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: And so now you're gonna kill me?

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS KING
dialogues.text: Do you know what you did wrong? Sam opens his eyes completely, looking up at his accuser

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (nervous) No. The Homeless King lifts up his hand, revealing a few dog biscuits in his palm.

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS KING
dialogues.text: We found these in your pocket. Sam says nothing. The Homeless King shuffles the biscuits in his hand and considers their importance.

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS KING
dialogues.text: Why do you have dog biscuits in your pocket? Sam stares at the dirty man with deep anger.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I used to like a girl who had a dog. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Homeless King thinks about this for a moment, narrowi his eyes. He shakes his head - a tiny grin of skepticism his face.

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS KING
dialogues.text: When was that?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: A long time ago. The Homeless King considers the response - debates a repl

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS KING
dialogues.text: Did she stop loving you?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Uh huh. The Homeless King stares into Sam's eyes - waiting for mo He repeats his question like a mantra.

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS KING
dialogues.text: Why do you have dog biscuits in your pocket? Sam doesn't answer. He stares back defiantly - angry - resentful.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I was waiting for her to take me back. I wanted to give the dog a treat and rub its ears - like the way I used to. And everything would be good again. The Homeless King moves closer, looking down at his priso with Christ-like eyes. He unlocks Sam's chains and steps the side - offering a clear path towards the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS KING
dialogues.text: You can go now.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS KING
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You're not gonna kill me?

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS KING
dialogues.text: I don't think so... we might. I'm not sure yet. Obviously don't mention any of this to anyone. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I won't. Sam stands up and begins to cross the room - hesitantly.

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS KING
dialogues.text: Ok. Well... Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Goodbye. Sam walks to the doorway. He reaches a tall staircase. Sam begins to climb up the very long and very narrow row stone steps. Where does this staircase go? Sam lifts a metal door. Bright light pours down into the passageway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam emerges in the parking lot of the 76 gas station near Hillhurst and Los Feliz. The street is bustling. The sun peeks through the clouds. Music zips past Sam as cars race by in both directions. L Gaga. Neil Diamond. David Bowie. Cher. Jesus and the Brid Dracula. Just pieces. Fragmented and warped together by the dopple effect. All songs become one singular melody... I'm pickin' up good vibrations She givin' me excitations Good good good gooooood Vibraazzzgwuqhewuwjhhajasodasdkasdasda! !!! Sam walks along the busy road of Los Feliz. Cars race by. Loudly. Sam is in a daze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam stares up at the hills above the trees. He squints and strains, imagining 8-bit Egyptian mazes an tombs from Super Mario Bros. 2 - superimposed over the hillside. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A sort of X-Ray Vision... sweeping slowly across the hori Sam imagines level after level of Mario-esque tunnels wit the majestic green hillside. Is this what's underneath?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam passes some Latino teenagers picnicking near the Mulholland Memorial fountain. The kids are listening to m as they eat their food. Madonna's "Express Yourself" plays loudly from the cheap portable speakers on their blanket... You don't need diamond rings Or eighteen karat gold Fancy cars that go very fast You know they never last, no, no What you need is a big strong hand To lift you to your higher ground Make you feel like a queen on a throne Make him love you till you can't come down You'll never come down Sam crosses the I-5 overpass. Traffic is thick. The cars slowly now - bumper to bumper down Los Feliz. Sam looks a them as he walks along. Below him, cars idle along the I-5 freeway. Here is the site of Kevin McCarthy's dramatic plea for he the conclusion of "Invasion of the Body Snatchers". Should Sam scream a warning? Yell out to the passing cars He says nothing. Watching them pass. Remaining silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam walks along the sidewalk, passing by the Contact Lens Billboard. Workers are switching out the signage. The contact lens a being replaced with a McDonalds advertisement. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sam' ex-girlfriend's face is cut in half - partially cove by Ronald McDonald's grin. The oddly divided girl looks down at Sam and the passing of Los Feliz Boulevard. Her subtle expression is supplant Ronald's enormous and disturbing smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam passes by the coffee shop. He looks inside at the pre bakery girls. They laugh and chatter as they clean the co and flip chairs onto tables. He sees them through the window's faded sharpie handwriti still visible across the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam enters his apartment with a bag of groceries. He ignores the large, spray-painted mark across his dinin room wall. °c Sam unloads the bag: A 2-quart container of Tropicana Ori Orange Juice and a box of Nabisco Original Premium Saltin Crackers. He sets the groceries on the counter alongside an opened priority envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is sitting on the couch, staring at the July 1970 Pla cover. In the background, the groceries remain along the counter though opened. Crackers spread like dominos out of their plastic bag. A pulp covered glass of orange juice - half drunk. Sarah's picture rests on Sam's lap. The gun sits neatly on the white CB2 tv tray before him. His dusty VCR is on the carpet - cables and plugs running it to the back of the tv. A shaky VHS recording plays on the television. It is "Sev Heaven". Janet Gaynor cries and emotes with grand perfect and beauty. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sam's Nintendo lies on the carpet next to the VCR. A tang mess of chords and old entertainment technology. The upside down Playmate stares at Sam... from under the water. He hears the parrot cawing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rrrottafendnnnddddd! Sam looks towards the window. Breathing slowly. Debating. unblinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam stands in the hallway, knocking on an apartment door The Bird Woman opens the door, wearing a t-shirt and no b She looks at Sam with a suspicious expression. The look o housewife greeting a door-to-door salesman. Sam smiles to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and the Bird Woman lie naked on the living room floor sweaty and tired. A throw-rug under their bodies. A couch cushion under the heads. The Topless Bird Woman nuzzles close to Sam. Affectionate smells his chest and shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: TOPLESS BIRD WOMAN
dialogues.text: Is that patchouli?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: No. The parrot caws from outside on the woman's balcony. Sam towards it - perched in its cage.

dialogues.speaker: PARROT
dialogues.text: Nawwwwwddduuumeennndd

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What's the bird saying? The Bird Woman looks back toward the patio. She shakes he head. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BIRD WOMAN
dialogues.text: I don't know. Honestly, I've always wondered, but I have no idea. Sam nods his head and stares at the bird. It shouts once He takes it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam stands alone on the woman's balcony. The birds are qu in their cages. Gentle rustling. Lighting a cigarette, Sam looks across the courtyard to h own apartment - hidden in the trees and foliage. He looks through the open window into his home. It's quiet and still. Finally... Sam's front door opens, and the Apartment Manager steps i the dimly lit living room. The Sheriff follows him inside Sam watches the men, from his hidden perch, as they sift through his things, pointing at the walls and shaking the heads. Sam exhales smoke... The End Credits Roll. We hear REM's "Strange Currencies"...

dialogues.speaker: SINCERE VOICE
dialogues.text: (singing) I don't know why you're mean to me when I call on the telephone... and I don't know what you mean to me, but I want to turn you on, turn you up figure you out... I want to take you on... these words "you will be mine" these words "you will be mine"... all the time...  cn
